title: Halloween party shooting leaves three dead and multiple casualties in Long Beach
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Click to play Tap to play

Get the biggest daily news stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

At least three people have been killed in a mass shooting at a Halloween party.

Up to nine others were wounded in the hail of gunfire.

Paramedics treated the shooting victims outside a house in Long Beach, California, and at least five ambulances left the scene with patients, it was reported.

Neighbours told local media that the house was hosting a Halloween party when shots rang out around 10.45pm local time on Tuesday.

One neighbour said she heard 10 shots and another said she heard "a lot more than that", CBS 2 reported.

Have you been affected by the incident? Email webnews@mirror.co.uk.

Locals described it as a "nice" neighbourhood and "surprising" that such an extreme act of violence would take place there.

Multiple shell casings were visible in an alley behind the house, ABC 7 reported.

The TV station said three people were killed.

Long Beach Police have not yet commented on the number of victims or if more than one gunman was involved.

The force urged people to stay away from the area.
description: Up to 12 people were shot when at least one gunman opened fire at a Halloween party in the Los Angeles suburb of Long Beach
